public class SettingsRegistry extends MemorySettingsStore implements SettingsTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.core.vm.JavaTrait

A lookup registry of user-defined settings Objects.

Settings

The global SettingsRegistry registry is returned by globalSettings(), and it is the default registry returned by settingsFor(Object). The global settings registry is normally the central point of settings registration and lookup for an application. It allows settings objects to be easily queried from client code anywhere. Convenient access to the global settings registry is provided by SettingsTrait, and by the Component class in kivakit-component, which implements SettingsTrait. A component can have its own settings registry (not a common use case) by overriding the SettingsTrait.settingsForThis() method (which returns the global settings registry by default).

How Settings are Registered

A component can easily register settings objects with the SettingsTrait registerSettings*() methods. In particular, they can be registered from a SettingsStore with the method registerSettingsIn(SettingsStore). A typical way for a component to register the settings objects in a SettingsStore is something like: 

 registerSettingsIn(packageForThis());

Settings that are loaded from stores or explicitly added with registration methods are indexed in the store under multiple keys:

  1. The settings class
  2. The settings class interfaces
  3. All superclasses
  4. All superinterfaces

This makes it possible to look up an interface implementation using the implemented interface. For example: 

 var driver = requireSettings(DatabaseDriverSettings.class);

might return an instance of QuantumDatabaseDriverSettings. This is the same pattern used in the global object Registry, to which settings objects are also added.

The Easiest Way to Register Settings

Note that the easiest way to register settings is to use the Application class' built-in -deployment switch. This switch is present by default (although it can be turned off by overriding Application.ignoreDeployments()) and will automatically load and register settings using the names of the sub-packages present in the deployments package next to your application class.

How Settings are Looked Up

The lookupSettings*() and requireSettings*() methods provided by SettingsTrait can be used to locate settings objects from any Component (see the kivakit-component project). Settings are located according to this series of steps:

  1. Look for the object in the resources in the (comma separated) sequence of folders specified by KIVAKIT_SETTINGS_FOLDERS
  2. Look for the object in the global lookup Registry
  3. Look for the object in the (usually global) SettingsRegistry

This sequence allows the command line, and explicit registration of an object, to override any settings loaded from deployments or other settings stores. Note that if you use require(Class) instead of requireSettings(Class), the specified class will be looked up and found in the global Registry, and the steps above will not be followed. This means that it will not be possible to override the location of settings from the command line. The same applies to the lookup(Class) and lookupSettings(Class) methods.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
